universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class ViewPagerWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • ViewPager
      • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.ViewPagerWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Slideable, Widget, WidgetGroup

    public class ViewPagerWidget
extends ViewPager
implements WidgetGroup
    Extended version of ViewPager. This updated ViewPager supports tinting for the Android versions below LOLLIPOP and other useful features described below including pulling feature.

    Tinting

    Tinting is supported via Xml attributes listed below:
    • uiBackgroundTint
    • uiBackgroundTintMode

    Note, that on LOLLIPOP and above SDK versions can be also used Xml attributes listed above where in such case will be used the native tinting.

    This widget group also overrides all SDK methods used to tint its components like setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) or setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode), so these can be used regardless the current version of SDK but invoking of these methods below LOLLIPOP can be done only directly upon instance of this widget group otherwise NoSuchMethodException will be thrown.

    Sliding

    This updated view group allows updating of its current position along x and y axis by changing fraction of these properties depending on its current size using the new animation framework introduced in HONEYCOMB via ObjectAnimators API.

    Changing of fraction of X or Y is supported via these two methods:

    • setFractionX(float)
    • setFractionY(float)

    For example if an instance of this view group class needs to be slided to the right by its whole width, an Xml file with ObjectAnimator would look like this: 

      <objectAnimator xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
                  android:propertyName="fractionX"
                  android:valueFrom="0.0"
                  android:valueTo="1.0"
                  android:duration="300"/>
    This can be especially useful for fragment transitions framework, where this view group would be used as a root for a view hierarchy of a specific fragment.

    XML attributes

    See ViewPager, ViewPagerWidget Attributes

    Default style attribute

    uiViewPagerStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

        public Drawable getBackground()
        Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return an instance of TintDrawable if tint has been applied via setBackgroundTintList(ColorStateList).

        The original wrapped drawable can be obtained via DrawableWrapper.getDrawable().

      • setFractionX

        public void setFractionX(float fraction)
        Description copied from interface: Slideable
        Sets the fraction for X axis of this view. This fraction determines how this view should be moved along its X axis depends on its current width.

        Setting this value for example to 1 will move this view by 100 % of its width to the right.

        Note, that setting this value out of the proper range can resolve into unpredictable results.

        Specified by:
        setFractionX in interface Slideable
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [-1, 1].

      • getFractionX

        public float getFractionX()
        Description copied from interface: Slideable
        Returns the current fraction for the X axis of this view.
        Specified by:
        getFractionX in interface Slideable
        Returns:
        Fraction for X axis.

      • setFractionY

        public void setFractionY(float fraction)
        Description copied from interface: Slideable
        Sets the fraction for Y axis of this view. This fraction determines how this view should be moved along its Y axis depends on its current height.

        Setting this value for example to -1 will move this view by 100 % of its height to the top.

        Note, that setting this value out of the proper range can resolve into unpredictable results.

        Specified by:
        setFractionY in interface Slideable
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [-1, 1].

      • setCurrentItem

        public void setCurrentItem(int item,
                           int duration)
        Same as setCurrentItem(int), but this will use the specified duration for scroll. Note, that this duration will be used only for this particular call, if you want to use a specific duration for all setCurrentItem(int) related calls, set your desired duration by setPageScrollDuration(int).
        Parameters:
        item - A position of page to scroll to.
        duration - The desired scroll duration used to scroll to the specified page in milliseconds.

      • setScroller

        public void setScroller(@NonNull
                        Scroller scroller)
        Sets the scroller for this view pager used to apply and animate scroll to the pages of this pager.
        Parameters:
        scroller - The desired scroller to be used by this pager.

      • setPageSwipingEnabled

        public void setPageSwipingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the swiping of pages on a user's touch/drag is enabled or not. This enables/disables only interaction for the user, calls to setCurrentItem(int) and similar methods will still be working.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if page swiping should be enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPageSwipingEnabled, isPageFlingSwipingEnabled()

      • isPageSwipingEnabled

        public boolean isPageSwipingEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the swiping of pages is enabled for a user or not.
        Returns:
        True if page swiping is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setPageSwipingEnabled(boolean)

      • setPageFlingSwipingEnabled

        public void setPageFlingSwipingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the swiping of multiple pages on a user's fling is enabled or not. Enabling this feature means, that the user can by fling scroll multiple pages at once. How many pages will be scrolled at fling depends on the velocity of a specific fling. Sensitivity for the fling can be set by setPageFlingSwipingSensitivity(float).
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if page swiping on fling should be enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPageFlingSwipingEnabled, isPageFlingSwipingEnabled()

      • isPageFlingSwipingEnabled

        public boolean isPageFlingSwipingEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the swiping of multiple pages on fling is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        True if page swiping on fling is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setPageFlingSwipingEnabled(boolean)

      • setPageFlingSwipingSensitivity

        public void setPageFlingSwipingSensitivity(float sensitivity)
        Sets a sensitivity for the velocity of a user's fling used to determine whether to handle a particular fling to swipe multiple pages at once or not.

        Note, that velocity of fling is computed in UiConfig.VELOCITY_UNITS.

        Parameters:
        sensitivity - The desired sensitivity. The bigger sensitivity is, the less pages will be scrolled at once and in reverse.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPageFlingSwipingSensitivity, getPageFlingSwipingSensitivity(), setPageFlingSwipingEnabled(boolean)

      • getPageFlingSwipingSensitivity

        public float getPageFlingSwipingSensitivity()
        Returns the current sensitivity for the fling velocity used to determine whether to handle a user's fling or not.

        Default value: 6000

        Returns:
        Swiping sensitivity.
        See Also:
        setPageFlingSwipingSensitivity(float)

      • setPageScrollDuration

        public void setPageScrollDuration(int duration)
        Sets the duration for scroll used whenever setCurrentItem(int) or similar methods are called upon this view pager.
        Parameters:
        duration - The desired scroll duration in milliseconds. Pass here -1 to clear the current one, so the default one will be used.
        See Also:
        getPageScrollDuration()

      • getPageScrollDuration

        public int getPageScrollDuration()
        Returns the current duration used for scrolling of pages of this pager.
        Returns:
        Scroll duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setPageScrollDuration(int)

      • setPageScrollRelativeDurationEnabled

        public void setPageScrollRelativeDurationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the duration of page scroll should be computed as a relative one depends on the count of pages to be scrolled, or as a fixed one regardless how many pages will be scrolled.

        If the relative duration is enabled, the scroll duration requested by setPageScrollDuration(int) is used as a base, so a duration for the current page scroll is computed like so: Math.abs(getCurrentItem() - position) * pageScrollDuration

        Parameters:
        enabled - True if relative duration of page scroll should be enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isPageScrollRelativeDurationEnabled()

      • isPageScrollRelativeDurationEnabled

        public boolean isPageScrollRelativeDurationEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the duration of pages scroll is computed as a relative one or not.
        Returns:
        True if duration of page scroll is computed as relative one, false as fixed one.
        See Also:
        setPageScrollRelativeDurationEnabled(boolean)

      • setHideSoftKeyboardOnTouchEnabled

        Description copied from interface: WidgetGroup
        Specifies a boolean flag indicating whether this view group should request hiding of the soft keyboard whether it is touched.
        Specified by:
        setHideSoftKeyboardOnTouchEnabled in interface WidgetGroup
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to hide soft keyboard automatically on touch, false otherwise.

        Specified by:
